page.name: Share these four charts with your learners
page.content:
Show the following four charts with the learners in your classroom. Explain that while this information is useful, it doesn't tell the whole story. For example, this data doesn't show the dedication or determination of the learners currently in the room. You had to overcome so much to get here. That is not reflected in this data. 


Source:  https://nrs.ed.gov/rt/reports/aggregate/2019/all

After reviewing the charts, work with the learners to create some questions that could reflect the "whole" experience of the learners in the classroom. Then ask the students to take the survey and post the results around the room. 

Sample questions: 

  • Do you have a job? 
  • Do you have people you take care of (parents, children, friends)? 
  • Have you ever completed a difficult task?
  • Have you ever learned something new?
